column4: When installing Ubuntu: How do I choose what partition to use for SWAP?
the installer will give you a choice, if you choose manual/guided partitioning
I'm going manual, because I've had a lot of problems
or you could just run partition editor from live cd and set it up there, just tell the install which to use as swap...
dont think its much diff, if memory serves, just not that 'pretty'
My problem is that I don't know how to tell the install which one to use as swap >.>
in the partitioner? edit and mount as swap?
Mount as swap... I see two relevant options: mount point and mount choice or something like that (using Norwegian installer)
why are u using the alternate install cd?
Because the normal one gives me errors
where are u in the install process
I'm in the part where I select partitions. Hold on, I'll take some pictures
First picture: http://img254.imageshack.us/img254/7322/dscn0698rp3.jpg It's Norwegian, so I hope you're good at guessing/know this menu well...
at some point u should see something like this.. http://users.piuha.net/martti/comp/ubuntu/en/raid16.png
